SA9-d-03-17-91-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 220 HAD ARRIVED AT OTTUMWA, CHANGED CREW, AND PULLED TO THE WEST END OF THE YARD WHERE THEY STOPPED TO MAKE A SETOUT OF CARS TOWARDS NO. 4 TRACK. THEY WERE SHOVING EASTWARD WHEN THE CONDUCTOR OBSERVED A MOVEMENT FROM THE EAST END OF THE YARD. THE ENGINEER NOTED SLACK RUN IN, STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND ADVISED THE GROUND CREW THAT SOMETHING WAS WRONG. THE HEAD BRAKEMAN INSPECTED THE CARS AND FOUND THE 32ND THROUGH THE 37TH CARS FROM THE HEAD END DERAILED. THE DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY A BROKENRAIL ON THE SOUTH RAIL OF NO. 4 TRACK. ALL DERAILED CARS WERE UPRIGHT, TWO LEANING SOUTH AND CONTENTS WERE NOT DAMAGED. THE 35TH AND 36TH CARS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIAL DERAILED HOWEVER THEY DID NOT RELEASE ANY MATERIAL. THERE WAS NO SERVICE DISRUPTION. NO DISCIPLINARY ACTION WAS TAKEN AS TRAIN CREW WAS NOT AT FAULT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA19-d-03-24-91-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 230 WITH FOUR UNITS, 73 LOADS AND ONE EMPTY, 9,470 TONS WAS TRAVELING EASTWARD NEAR MARQUETTE,IOWA WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY. UPON INSPECTION, THE CREW FOUND THAT THE 14TH THROUGH 25TH HEAD CARS, ALL LOADS OF CORN, WERE DERAILED. TWO OF THE DERAILED CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT WHILE THE OTHER TENWERE ON THEIR SIDES. THE TRAIN HAD BEEN DESCENDING A 0.80% GRADE AND ROUNDING AN 8 DEGREE CURVE WHEN THE CARS DERAILED. INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE CAUSE OF THE MISHAP WAS BROKEN RAIL CAUSED BY SHELLING OF THE RAIL HEAD DEVELOPING INTO A DETAIL FRACTURE. NO EXCEPTION WAS TAKEN TO EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE AND NO DISCIPLINE WAS ASSESSED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA20-d-03-24-91-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 670 WITH 77 LOADS HEADING IN ON TRACK #8 INTO THE YARD AT THIEF RIVER FALLS STOPPED WHEN AIR DUMPED. NINE POTASH CARS WERE DERAILED. CAUSE OF DERAILMENT DETERMINED TO BE WIDE GAUGE DUE TO DEFECTIVE CROSSTIES. ALL CARS WERE UPRIGHT. FOUR CARS HAD WHEELS CLOSE TO RAIL, BUT SOUTH RAIL WAS TIPPEDOVER. TWO CARS WERE UPRIGHT BUT TIES AND RAIL WERE BROKEN UNDER THEM SO TRUCKS DUG INTO GROUND. TWOOTHER CARS WERE UPRIGHT WITH BROKEN RAIL AND TIES AND BOTH LEANING 15 TO 20 DEGREES TO SOUTH.ONE CARWAS UPRIGHT WITH TIES BROKEN UNDER EAST TRUCKS IN GROUND AND ONE WHEEL DERAILED ON WEST TRUCKS. ALLDERAILED CARS WERE RERAILED BY HULCHER. ONE CAR OF POTASH WAS TRANSFERRED TO CLEAR THE MAIN LINE. ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT REPLACED 200 DEFECTIVE CROSSTIES AND 900 FEET OF RAIL. NO EXCEPTION WAS TAKENTO EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE AND NO DISCIPLINE WAS ASSESSEDNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA15-d-03-05-91-SOO.Narrative: BN TRAIN NO. 31 DERAILED FOUR HEAD CARS WHILE PULLING OUT OF THE WEST END OF THE ORTONVILLE SIDING ONTO THE MAIN TRACK WHILE OPERATING OVER SOO LINE TRACKAGE. SPEED AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT WAS 8MPH AND THE ENGINE WAS BEING OPERATED IN THE SECOND POWER THROTTLE POSITION. AS THE TRAIN MOVED ONTO MAIN TRACK, A WIDE GAUGE CONDITION DEVELOPED UNDER THE WEST END OF THE BSPX 296, 13TH HEAD CAR.WHEN BSPX 296 DERAILED, IT PULLED THE EAST END OF BSPX 247, THE 12TH HEAD CAR OFF THE TRACK. THE WIDE GAUGE CONDITION THEN CAUSED TWO OTHER CARS TO DERAIL. THE ENTIRE DERAILMENT ENCOMPASSED A TRACK DISTANCE OF APPROXIMATELY 160 FEET. THE BN ENGINEER EXPLAINED THAT HE STOPPED WHEN HE FELT THE TRAIN "BOGDOWN". NO DISCIPLINE WAS ASSESSED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

CARS WERE DRAGGED ON GROUND FOR 800 FEET, DAMAGINE 600 TIES AND ONE SET OF SWITCH TIES AND 100 FEET OF RAIL AND TIPPING 450 FEET OF RAIL. WHEN TRAIN STOPPED, THERE WERE 60 CARS FOULING MAIN LINE AND BLOCKING STREET CROSSING. ALL DERAILED CARS WERE NEXT TO RAIL AND UPRIGHT. CREW OF TRAIN 234, TRAINMASTER AND ROADMASTER SHOVED TRAIN BACK FROM FOULING OF MAIN TRACK TO CLEAR CROSSING IN AUSTIN. HULCHER WAS CALLED TO RERAIL CARS AND MASON CITY CAR DEPARTMENT AND TRACK DEPT. SB911-d-03-14-91-SBRR.Narrative: SBRR 44, A LIGHT LOCOMOTIVE, TRAVELING LONG-END FIRST, WAS HEADED EASTBOUND UNDER THE OPERATION OF ATWO-MAN CREW. THE SINGLE TRACK OVER WHICH THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS MOVING HAD ALREADY BEEN GIVEN TO A HY-RAIL VEHICLE AND ITS TWO OPERATORS BY VERBAL PERMISSION EARLIER IN THE MORNING. THE CREW OF SBRR 44WAS FULLY AWARE OF THE FACT THAT THE HY-RAIL VEHICLE COULD BE ANYWHERE OUT ON THE TRACKS, AND WAS THEREFORE PROCEEDING AT RESTRICTED SPEED. THERE WERE NO FATALITIES OR INJURIES BECAUSE THE OPERATORS OF THE HY-RAIL VEHICLE WERE AWAY FROM THE TRACK AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION. THE ENGINEER HAD BEEN ON DUTY JUST UNDER THREE (3) HOURS AND WAS NOT UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ANY SUBSTANCE, NOR DID HE HAVEANY PHYSICAL CONDITION THAT WOULD HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO HIS LAPSE OF ATTENTION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

BOOTH ALLEGEDLY SET 2 HAND BRAKES ON ACFX 88947 AND ACFX 73854. CREW WENT ON TO SWITCH SOUTH AND NORTH TRACKS. CREW SHOVED 5 CARS ON THE NORTHSIDE OF HILL TRACK, THEN WENT INTO SOUTH WEST TRACK WITH ENGINES AND CAB. CREW COUPLED TRACK AND WERE PULLING OUT WITH 17 CARS WHEN HILL TRACK ROLLED OUT INTO SIDE OF SOUTH WEST CUT, STRIKING AND DERAILING THE 9TH, 10TH, AND 11TH CARS IN CONSIST AND DAMAGING 2 EAST END CARS FROM HILL TRACK.CREW WAS"REASONABLE CAUSE" DRUG TESTED, BUT RESULTS WERE INVALID DUE TO ASST TRAINMASTER USING MANDATORY FORMS WITH REASONABLE CAUSE KIT AND TEST. INVESTIGATION WAS HELD TO DETERMINE CAUSE AND RESULTED IN ENGINE FOREMAN/CONDUCTOR W.A. BOOTH, JR BEING DISMISSED DUE TO VIOLATION OF OPERATING RULE 103(B).NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
